Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a deep double-convex body with a pointed bulge at each side. The base-ring is indistinct and damaged. The filling-hole is surrounded by a double moulding, encircled by a segmented band. The round-topped nozzle has a splayed rounded end, and is decorated with two parallel grooves on top. Covered with a streaky red-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q589)
